[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: UserTransactionRequest] [Sequence Number Manipulation] Can an attacker craft multiple transactions with the same sequence_number from a single sender, bypassing nonce-based replay protection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: UserTransactionRequest] [Gas Amount Overflow] Can max_gas_amount be set to u64::MAX and when multiplied with gas_unit_price cause integer overflow in fee calculation, allowing zero-fee transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: UserTransactionRequest] [Gas Price Manipulation] Can gas_unit_price be set to 0, allowing attackers to spam the network with free transactions that consume validator resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: UserTransactionRequest] [Expiration Bypass] Can expiration_timestamp_secs be set to None or a very large timestamp value, allowing transactions to remain valid indefinitely and be replayed years later? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: Event] [Type Mismatch] Can the type field (MoveType) and type_str field be inconsistent, causing type confusion when indexers parse events differently than the VM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: Event] [Data Malformation] Can the data string field contain non-JSON or malicious JSON that causes parsing errors in off-chain indexers relying on event data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: EventKey] [Creation Number Collision] Can two accounts generate events with identical creation_number and account_address, causing event key collisions and data corruption in event stores? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: TransactionInfo] [Gas Used Mismatch] Can gas_used exceed the max_gas_amount from UserTransactionRequest, indicating gas metering bypass or allowing overcharge attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.transaction.v1.rs] [Struct: TransactionInfo] [Success Flag Manipulation] Can the success boolean be set to true for transactions that should have failed, bypassing error handling and allowing invalid state transitions? (Critical)
